instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2442: What is A2442? A2442 is a model number for a 14 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3650, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02098..
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Hinge Sensor
threads.message:
Hi mates ! I received a MacBook 14" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> at the shop this week that is not able to stay on, when you press the power button you can see the screen for 2 seconds, no trackpad neither keyboard activity, and screen goes black again. When the hinge sensor is unplugged, it works fine. After further inspection, the board is clean but the hinge sensor had liquid damage. 

I have seen that contrary to the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2019 16" you can't replaced the hinge sensor with a brand new one on Aliexpress because of a program. WTF, was it really needed ?

My question is pretty obvious I guess but I'd like your feedback, and maybe a solution if someone have one. Is it this chip that contain the "program" (photo attached) ? I was able to save the pads on the pcb, but 2 on the chip are definitly gone :'(

Thank you for your time

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Hinge Sensor
threads.message:
That chip communicates with the CPU through SPI bus.
SMC part requires only UR330 outputs to control TP/KB, internal video and digital microphone.

You should check if at least one of <SIGNAL>ND_1V8</SIGNAL>, or <SIGNAL>MGL_1V8</SIGNAL> lines reacts correctly when close/open the lid.
To change the angle sensor, you need to program/calibrate it.
